ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 60
ygData.msgSnippet: Wayne, Ahh, how do you have any clue what kind of shape I m in?  Your really living in a fantasy world.  Just so you know, I m 6 foot 4, weigh in around 255.
ygData.messageBody:
Wayne,

Ahh, how do you have any clue what kind of shape I'm in? Your really living
in a fantasy world. Just so you know, I'm 6 foot 4, weigh in around 255. I
exercise regularly, and consider myself in good shape. I regularly play
basketball ( full court), put in about 20 miles a week in road work. I went
to school on a football scholarship (Athlete), and as I said I've been
fighting in 100lbs of armor with 5 lbs swords for about 10 years. No, I have
not trained all my life, and I'm not a Troll, though I have been compared to
a barbarian on the field :). Whilke I need a rest every 5 minutes or so of
srenuaous activity in armor, I do tend to wear all day, and fight all day,
just not continueously. Oh, if anyone's interested, there will be a large
Invitational Atournement for this kind of martial art (Medival
swordsmanship) in Vegas next October. Look for it as an Xtreme game.

Now, let's look at this in a purely historical context. The Norman knights,
who did train all their lives, could usually last between 10 and 15 minutes
in the heat of battle before having to withdraw. This is documented very
well at the Battle of Hastings 1066AD. Of course, mounted knights faired
much better. The thing to remember is that in a day long battle (they
actually only lasted a few hours) The fighting was not fast and furious,
but consisted of a series of pushes and withdrawals. In between, everyone
rested.

So Wayne, why don't you tear yourself away from the screen, go outside and
try some of these things for yourself. ya know, the stuff in the computer
is supposed to simulate what is happening out here.



> -----Original Message-----
> From: Wayne Sheppard [mailto:mrwayne@...]
> Sent: Friday, June 11, 1999 12:43 PM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Digest Number 60
>
>
> From: "Wayne Sheppard" <mrwayne@...>
>
> > Date: Fri, 11 Jun 1999 09:32:11 -0700
> > From: "Obergfell, Steven" <SObergfell@...>
> >Subject: Re: Petition or Melee vs. Caster damage
> >
> >But the Warrior does have a limiting factor: Stamina. Once
> again, I will
> >draw from my experience in wielding broad swords in real
> life. After about
> >3 to 5 minutes of constant fighting, in 100 lbs. of armor
> guess what, you
> >are wiped out and need to rest a bit. Just like the mage
> has to rest while
> >dealing out those spells, we warriors should need to rest
> after fighting in
> >all that armor and swinging that 3 to 5 lbs. sword around, 9
> lbs. in the
> >case of great swords.
>
>
> Once again, your real life experiences have no bearing on EQ,
> a fantasy
> role-playing game.
>
> Maybe you need a rest every 3-5 minutes because your stamina
> is much lower
> than that of a troll or barbarian. Maybe if you spent your whole life
> training to be a warrior, you would have greater stamina. EQ
> Warriors can
> fight longer than your 3-5 minutes because they exercise
> instead of playing
> video games.
>
>
> Wayne
>
>
>
